Hee leading swiftly rowld
In tangles, and made intricate seem strait,
To mischief swift. Hope elevates, and joy
Bright'ns his Crest, as when a wandring Fire
Compact of unctuous vapor, which the Night
Condenses, and the cold invirons round,
Kindl'd through agitation to a Flame,
Which oft, they say, some evil Spirit attends
Hovering and blazing with delusive Light,
Misleads th' amaz'd Night-wanderer from his way
To Boggs and Mires, and oft through Pond or Poole,
There swallow'd up and lost, from succour farr.”
-John Milton, _Paradise Lost_}} ==Useful Info== '''Insubstantial wisps''' are very irritating monsters, even worse than early [[imp]]s. They have high [[evasion]], [[blink]] constantly, and resist nearly everything. To make matters worse, they are encountered in packs and can be dangerous if they surround you. Wisps are found in the [[Dungeon]], [[The Swamp]], and [[the Abyss]]. [[Wisp Form]] is a [[bad form]] that is similar to the monster. ==Spells== {{Spellcaster2 |number= |slot1=[[Blink]] |flags1={{Magical slot flag}} |slot2=[[Static Discharge]] |flags2={{Magical slot flag}} }} {{clear}} ==Tips & Tricks== *Melee characters can eventually take them out with standard attack strategies, and heavy armour combined with [[electricity]] resistance greatly reduces the threat they pose. It just requires more patience than usual. *Spellcasters should try to use [[Earth Magic]] and non-elemental [[Conjurations]], such as [[Magic Dart]], [[Iskenderun's Mystic Blast]], or the highly effective and 100% accurate [[Airstrike]]. [[Hailstorm]] will also partially work (and can strike multiple wisps at once). High-level elemental spells can take them out with repeated use, but lesser elemental spells will take too long to be practical. ==History== *In [[0.26]], insubstantial wisps were replaced with [[will-o-the-wisp]]s. [[Wisp form]] is still in the game, though. *In [[0.16]], became more fragile & less numerous, but gained Static Discharge. *In [[0.11]], [[AC]] was lowered from 20 to 5.
